markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sword Cane](/Weapons.aspx?ID=127)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Concealable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=327" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 248 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Favored Weapon** [The Freeing Flame](/Deities.aspx?ID=231)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**Damage** 1d6 P

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)
</row>

</column>

---

This slender, rapier-like sword is concealed within a wooden or metal cane that serves as a sheath, making it an inconspicuous weapon easy to slip past inspections or into high-society events. A sword cane is typically 4 feet long when sheathed, and its hilt is usually capped with a wooden or metal decoration.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-15" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Infiltrator's Accessory](/Equipment.aspx?ID=736)
name: Sword Cane
